title: Symbol lookup error: undefined symbol: cudnnSetConvolutionGroupCount
body_html:
I am getting the following error after using #3831

python: symbol lookup error: /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so: undefined symbol: cudnnSetConvolutionGroupCount

The error was not present when using 0.2.0 from conda.

As per the discussion on #3831 with @apaszke , I re-ran the build process and searching for CUDNN in the build logs shows the following:

$ grep -i cudnn ~/Codes/pytorch/build.log 
-- Found CUDNN: /usr/local/cuda/include  
-- Found cuDNN: v7.0.4  (include: /usr/local/cuda/include, library: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so)
creating build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.5/torch/backends/cudnn
copying torch/backends/cudnn/__init__.py -> build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.5/torch/backends/cudnn
copying torch/backends/cudnn/rnn.py -> build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.5/torch/backends/cudnn
-- Detected cuDNN at /usr/local/cuda/lib64, /usr/local/cuda/include

I am trying to pin-point the exact code block which causes the issue, and will post it soon.

body:
I am getting the following error after using #3831 

```
python: symbol lookup error: /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so: undefined symbol: cudnnSetConvolutionGroupCount
```

The error was not present when using `0.2.0` from conda.

As per the discussion on #3831 with @apaszke , I re-ran the build process and searching for CUDNN in the build  logs shows the following:

```
$ grep -i cudnn ~/Codes/pytorch/build.log 
-- Found CUDNN: /usr/local/cuda/include  
-- Found cuDNN: v7.0.4  (include: /usr/local/cuda/include, library: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so)
creating build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.5/torch/backends/cudnn
copying torch/backends/cudnn/__init__.py -> build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.5/torch/backends/cudnn
copying torch/backends/cudnn/rnn.py -> build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.5/torch/backends/cudnn
-- Detected cuDNN at /usr/local/cuda/lib64, /usr/local/cuda/include
```

I am trying to pin-point the exact code block which causes the issue, and will post it soon.
